title: Conflict and Argument Idioms
content: Complete the idioms and phrases related to conflict and arguments by filling in the missing words.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: A [field 1] of wills
field_labels: 1. A [field 1] of wills - A disagreement where both sides are determined to win
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: Get off (someone's) [field 1]
field_labels: 2. Get off (someone's) [field 1] - Stop criticising or telling someone what to do
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: Bury the [field 1]
field_labels: 3. Bury the [field 1] - To stop an argument and agree to make peace
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: Send (someone) [field 1]
field_labels: 4. Send (someone) [field 1] - To tell someone to leave
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: Wipe the [field 1] clean
field_labels: 5. Wipe the [field 1] clean - To forget about previous disagreements or problems and to start again
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: [field 1] on thin ice
field_labels: 6. [field 1] on thin ice - Doing or saying something that could easily/quickly end up in a disagreement or trouble
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: Pick [field 1] in (something)
field_labels: 7. Pick [field 1] in (something) - Trying to find faults in something someone is doing or saying
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: An [field 1] branch
field_labels: 8. An [field 1] branch - Something you do, say or offer to try and end a disagreement
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: Add [field 1] to the fire
field_labels: 9. Add [field 1] to the fire - To make a situation or argument even worse
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: At each other's [field 1]
field_labels: 10. At each other's [field 1] - Always arguing (normally strongly)
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: throats (or throat)

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: A [field 1] point
field_labels: 11. A [field 1] point - A subject that someone is sensitive about and should therefore be avoided
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.

questions.instructions: Complete the idiom by filling in the missing word.
questions.question: A [field 1] battle
field_labels: 12. A [field 1] battle - A disagreement that has been going on for some time
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You got this idiom correct.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Review the meaning and try to think of the word that best fits the idiom.
